text: Guy Arnold (6 May 1932 – 4 January 2020) was a British explorer, travel writer, political writer and specialist in north-south relations. He wrote mainly in the areas of African history, politics, and international affairs. He lectured and taught courses on international affairs for over thirty years, at the Workers’ Educational Association and the University of Surrey. Arnold died in London of dementia-related problems on 4 January 2020, aged 87. ==References== Category:1932 births Category:2020 deaths Category:English journalists Category:British political writers Category:Writers from London
title: Guy Arnold
